mods.abstract: Image of man pointing with cigar in hand at a page of The Evening Telegram pinned to wall. Headline reads: "Main Italian Base Falls Greeks Isolate Second." Verso of photograph reads: "Cobourg greek [York?] East" with caption "Nobody in Cobourg has followed more closely the successful campaign of the Greeks against the Italians than "Andy," the Greek proprieter of a restaurant in Cobourg. Andy's restaurant is the stopover for scores of Air Force men and soldiers every week-end, and the genial proprietor arranges rides for the boys on trucks whose drivers also stop at the restaurant. Throughout the Greek and Italian battles Andy has been posting up the headlines, just as he is shown doing above. Naturally he has a wide grin on his face as he tacks up the front page of The Evening Telegram, which tells fo the rout of the Italians."
